title: Four Seasons Resort and Club Dallas at Las Colinas
text:
Four Seasons Resort and Club Dallas at Las Colinas is a five-star <a href="golf%20resort">golf resort</a> in Texas, located in the hills of <a href="Irving%2C%20Texas">Irving</a>, several miles northwest of <a href="Downtown%20Dallas">downtown</a> <a href="Dallas">Dallas</a>. It is operated by <a href="Four%20Seasons%20Hotels%20and%20Resorts">Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts</a> and is the only <a href="American%20Automobile%20Association">AAA</a> <a href="AAA%20Five%20Diamond%20Award">Five Diamond</a> resort and club in Texas.
The resort contains a 431-room <a href="hotel">hotel</a>, two <a href="restaurant">restaurant</a>s, <a href="bar%20%28establishment%29">lounge bars</a>, a <a href="spa">spa</a>, and an array of leisure facilities, including a <a href="swimming%20pool">swimming pool</a>, <a href="gym">gym</a>, <a href="tennis%20court">tennis court</a>s and two <a href="golf%20course">golf course</a>s, featuring a <a href="Tournament%20Players%20Club">Tournament Players Club</a> course, TPC Las Colinas, that hosted the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a>'s annual <a href="AT%26amp%3BT%20Byron%20Nelson">AT&T Byron Nelson</a>.
Golf.
The Four Seasons Resort and Club Dallas at Las Colinas is known for its <a href="golf">golf</a> facilities, which includes the TPC Las Colinas championship course that was designed by Jay Morrish in consultation with <a href="Byron%20Nelson">Byron Nelson</a> and <a href="Ben%20Crenshaw">Ben Crenshaw</a>. The course was constructed as a TPC stadium course, incorporating nine holes from the original Las Colinas Sports Club layout. Since it opened in 1983 (Crenshaw won the 1st event see wall of champions inside the sports club), it has hosted the PGA Tour's Byron Nelson event from 1983 to <a href="2017%20PGA%20Tour">2017</a>.
Starting in 1994, the PGA Tour has also made use of the resort's second course, Cottonwood Valley, for the first two rounds of the Byron Nelson Championship in order to lessen the impact of weather delays. This course was also designed by Jay Morrish this time alongside renowned <a href="golf%20course%20architect">golf course architect</a> <a href="Robert%20Trent%20Jones%2C%20Jr.">Robert Trent Jones, Jr.</a>
The resort also includes the Byron Nelson Golf School, a <a href="driving%20range">driving range</a> and other practice facilities.
